members.description: TODO
Extruder temperature if not overridden by a particular extrusion temperature.
members.name: Default Extruder Temperature

members.description: Idle Extruder temperature for toolhead we switch from (the one that will not be printing).  Use to control leaks, ooze, and stringing.
members.name: Default Idle Extruder Temperature

members.description: Additional delay adjustment parameter only used when a Dual Printer toggles its toolheads (extruders) and after the change we can affect the amount of delay enacted to allow for next extruder to ramp up to temperature.
members.name: Extra Toolhead Toggle Delay

members.description: Diameter of the plastic filament you will be using. If this value is too low, your extruder will extrude too much plastic. If it is too high, your extruder will extrude too little.
members.name: Filament Diameter

members.description: This number multiplies the amount of plastic coming out of the nozzle for this extruder.  Compounds on top of multiplier for extrusion profile.
Specify the diameter of the nozzle being used on this extruder
members.name: Nozzle Diameter

members.description: Length of filament retracted before travel moves. Retracting filament before travel moves helps to prevent stringing.
members.name: Retraction Distance

members.description: Rate at which your extruder will retract filament before travel moves
members.name: Retraction Speed

members.description: A travel move (post-retract, pre-restart) total distance must be greater than this value, or else z-hop will be left out of the jsontoolpath.
members.name: Minimum Distance For ZHop

members.description: Z distance the axis moves during retract/restart travel moves.
members.name: Z Hop Distance

members.description: Rate at which the z-axis moves during retract/restart travel moves.
members.name: Z Hop Rate

members.description: Extrusion rate when the extruder restarts after a retraction
members.name: Restart Speed

members.description: The Restart Distance is the sum of the Retract Distance and the Restart Extra Distance. Increasing this value will push out extra plastic, which helps eliminate gaps. Reducing this value will push out less plastic, which helps eliminate blobs.
members.name: Extra Restart Distance

members.description: Distance before a retract when extrusion should stop to allow leaking plastic to fill the gap up to the retract. Set to 0 to disable oozing.
members.name: Ooze Distance

members.description: Extrude at least this much filament between a restart and an ooze
members.name: Minimum Ooze Path Length

members.description: width of the purge fillpath
members.name: Purge Width

members.desctription: The path the purge wall will follow
members.name: Purge Path

members.desctription: Purge along this path at the very beginning of a print
members.name: Purge Line

members.description: X Position to move to when doing a fast toggle
Print Temperature
members.name: Print Temperature

members.description: Print speed during extrusion
members.name: Print Speed

members.description: Print speed during XY travel, if unset defaults to top-level travelSpeedXY.
members.name: Print Speed

members.description: Fan Cooling Speed
members.name: Filament Cooling Fan Speed

members.description: Extend the end of a path that ends in an ooze by this distance.
How much plastic, in mm of feedstock, to allow to ooze out at the end of an extrusion. Use this value if different from the one specified for the extruder.
Increases or decreases the amount of extruded plastic computed from the extrusion model by a constant factor.  Useful for debugging.
Z distance the axis moves during retract/restart travel moves.
members.name: Z Hop Distance

members.description: The Restart Distance is the sum of the Retract Distance and the Restart Extra Distance. Increasing this value will push out extra plastic, which helps eliminate gaps. Reducing this value will push out less plastic, which helps eliminate blobs.
members.name: Extra Restart Distance

members.description: Fill extrusion width per region type.
members.name: Extrusion Width

members.description: Sets the maximum height of this fill for VLH.
Sets the minimum height of this fill for VLH.
Sets the maximum width of this fill for VLH
Initial pattern orientation
Change in the pattern orientation in consecutive layers
Orientation at which the pattern repeats
If true, pattern fill direction is always fixed.
If true, pattern fill is always ordered in a fixed way.
If true, pattern fill is ordered consistently between layers when layers do not change.
How to execute the fill (feedrate, fanSpeed, etc.).  Maps to ExtrusionProfiles corresponding key for this fill region, unless overridden by the pattern implementation. (Previously known as fillGroup)

How to execute the fill for layers with small area (feedrate, fanSpeed, etc.).  Maps to ExtrusionProfiles corresponding key for this fill region, unless overridden by the pattern implementation. (Previously known as fillGroup)
Number of lines per linear fill line group - these lines will be spaced next to the original line, and may overlap if the pattern is too dense.
Density of lines in a linear fill line group - this density is independent of the pattern density, and additional lines will simply be spaced next to the original line.
Distance it takes to make the 90 degree turn between two sides of the diamond fill pattern
Overlap distance between neighboring columns of diamonds
Number of fill outlines to generate.
Distance of zipper(start over end) overlap when one single outline fill occurs (mm). Necessary for stability.
Spacing between fill outlines if more than one is present.
Spacing between infill area and its shells. If ( numFillOutlines < 1 ) this value has no effect.
Morphological opening (cleanup) to be applied to infillOutlines area before generating each outline.
Morphological opening (cleanup) of infilled areas resulting in no fill in small regions. (Morph closing if positive value is set.)
Density of the other symbiot pattern, if sybiotic=true, this value can not be set to zero.
Sets the spacing between the lines of a raft's base layer
Sets the length of the zig-zag pattern that forms the base of a raft
Distance of a lightning fill bolt zig-zag
Distance of a sin fill oscillation.
Height of a sin fill oscillation.
Whether a sin fill inverts its amplitude each layer, creating a 'weaved' or 'bizarro' pattern.
Number of sin samples per wavelength.
Number of layers extruded in same direction before rotation.  The stack will be alternating layers of this number.
Distance needed to turn from one line of linear fill to the next
Sets resolution of the Bezier curve. Higher the resolution, smoother the curve. It decides number of points that will be generated on the curve.
TODO description
Extruder to print this raft layer type with.
members.name: Extruder ID

members.description: Number of layers for this particular raft layer type.
members.name: Number of Layers

members.description: Distance between the outer edge of your object and the edge of the raft for this raft layer type.
members.name: Outset From Model Edge

members.description: Height expressed as thickness of this raft layer type.
members.name: Layer Thickness

members.description: An additional vertical offset between each layer of this raft layer type and the layer immediately below it. Use a negative value to compress layers together.
members.name: Z Offset

members.description: An additional on top of the already additional ZOffset.  Used to further tune raft surface layers for adhesion and quality.
members.name: First Surface Z Offset

members.description: Extrusion width for entire layer.
members.name: Layer Extrusion Width

members.description: Extrusion bead width for specific fill region.
members.name: Extrusion Width

members.description: Sets how far the infill overlaps the innermost shell. A lower setting will result in more overlap.
members.name: Infill Shell Spacing Multiplier

members.description: This defines the space between each pair of adjacent shells. The number is a multiplier of the extrusion width. Set this under 1 to have the insets overlap, and over one for gaps between the insets. In general, it's best to have the insets overlap slightly.
members.name: Inset Distance Multiplier

members.description: Number of outlines printed for each island within a layer. If any section of your model does not have room for this many shells, that section will be printed with the number that does fit.
members.name: Number of Shells

members.description: additional inset to outer-most shell
Extrusion Profile to use for the outer shell
Extrusion Profile to use for the inner shells
x
y
these are the heights to pause at
scale correction in x. 1 is no change
scale correction in y. 1 is no change
scale correction in z. 1 is no change
Run the edge follow algorithm on solid support chunks.
Combine z hops and filament retracts into one move to battle stringiness.
An inset in the x-y plane. Increasting this values increases your tolerances.
Height of each printed layer
members.name: Layer Height

members.description: Force the extrusions of the model base layer to be this wide.
members.name: Base layer width

members.description: Select to enable smart zipper placement algorithm.  This minimizes conspicuous zippers to improve print appearance by starting shell at most concave point of the polygon.
members.name: Smart Zipper

members.description: Minimum area threshold before shells are printed with low_speed_shell extrusion label.
members.name: Low Speed Shell Minimum

members.description: Select to have first-layer shells and floors filled in with baseLayerWidth of 2.5.  Useful better floors when printing with brims.  Useful for stronger adhesion when printing raft-less/brims-less.  Useful for printing when precise build plate leveling is not of interest/possible.
members.name: Padded Base

members.description: Extrusion width for Padded Base Layer.
members.name: Padded Base Extrusion Width

members.description: Adjust outermost outline of base layer when using padded base.  This allows minimal compensation for layer alignment in cases of close proximity footprints (think of a gear or moving parts) or z-leveling inaccuracies (affects plastic displacement as extrusions fuse together where buildplate is too close to nozzle). Negative value brings the outline inwards towards center of model.
members.name: Padded Base Outline Offset

members.description: Select to print your model with brims.  Can be used in tandem with rafts.  Brims generate on top of raft.
members.name: Brims

members.description: This sets how many shell layers the brims will be.
members.name: Number of Brims

members.description: This sets how many shell layers the brims created for enclosed areas within the external boundary of the model will be.  Imagine a donut - the donut hole, is an enclosed area.
members.name: Number of Enclosed Brims

members.description: Extrusion width on the brims shells. This value should be much wider than your nozzle width.
members.name: Brims Base Extrusion Width

members.description: This defines the distance between the model outline and the first brims shell.  Increasing the offset produces brims farther from the model hence easier to remove.  Decreasing this value increases brims adhesion to the model.
members.name: Brims Model Offset

members.description: This defines the amount of overlap the next brims shell applies to previous shell. In general, it's best to have the outsets overlap slightly for increased hold.
members.name: Brims Overlap Width

members.description: An additional vertical offset between brims and the layer immediately below it.  When using both raft and brims, increasing the spacing allows brims to be drooped onto the raft, allowing for both lateral support and easy removal from raft/brims mold.
members.name: Raft to Brims Spacing

members.description: When true, do not extrude when transitioning from one shell to another. This helps reduce blobbing with large numbers of shells
When true, do not extrude between adjacent infill lines. Which lines are considered adjacent is determined by adjacentFillLeakyDistanceRatio.
Two fill lines are considered adjacent when the connection between them is shorter than the product of this value and the extrusion width.
Maximum length of an extrusion made to avoid retraction. If avoiding a retraction would require a longer extrusion, we will retract and go to the closest object instead.
members.name: Maximum Connection Length

members.description: Thickness of the roof surface layers of the model in mm.  If not a multiple of layer height, the distance is rounded up to the next layer.
Thickness of solid layers under roof surface in mm.  Overrides roofThickness if larger.  If not a multiple of layer height, the distance is rounded up to the next layer.
Thickness of the floor surface layers of the model in mm.  If not a multiple of layer height, the distance is rounded up to the next layer.
Thickness of solid layers over floor surface in mm.  Overrides floorThickness if larger.  If not a multiple of layer height, the distance is rounded up to the next layer.
The larger this value, the greater the area of solid vs sparse on layer.
Thickness of the supported floor layers of the model in mm.  All floor layers within this distance are transformed into supported floors.
Additional outset distance of supported floor partitions.
Thickness of the rafted floor layers of the model in mm.  All floor layers within this distance are transformed into rafted floors.
Additional outset distance of rafted floor partitions.
Extending roofs inside solid regions to support shells from layers above can help shells on sloped surfaces stay in place
Remove regions of infill narrower than this distance
Features smaller than this area in square millimeters are removed
members.name: Coarseness

members.description: Minimum reduction in total area required for adding a thick sparse infill layer
Distance to inward pulse regions generated by the vertical aggregator.
Minimum required area for a split chunk to be printed.
Heated chamber temperature
members.name: Chamber Temperature

members.description: Heated platform temperature
members.name: Platform Temperature

members.description: Speed at which the extruder travels along the horizontal plane when it is not extruding plastic
members.name: Travel Speed

members.description: Build plate speed as it moves down between layers
members.name: Z-axis Travel Speed

members.description: Offset value in mm to reduce small sparse areas by.  We pulse in and then out to identify sparse areas in the geometry that will succeed better as solid regions.
members.name: Convert Sparse Pulse Value

members.description: Smallest area sparse region can be before we convert into solid.
members.name: Minimum Sparse Region Area

members.description: When generated support structures are smaller than this area, the base or footprint is not sturdy enough and may fall over.  We taper the support structure out from original area until this threshold.  Once the area is larger than this, we create support structures as columns like default.  (creates pencil looking structures that balance adhesion/lateral stability while limiting excess amount of footprint/support base that attaches to build plate or model material).
members.name: Minimum Area To Taper Supports Out

members.description: When generated support structures are larger than this area, we can save time and print material while ensuring print success.  We taper the support structure in from area at that point until this threshold.  Once the area is smaller than this, we create support structures as columns like default.
members.name: Maximum Area To Taper Supports In

members.description: Select to print your model on a raft
members.name: Raft

members.description: Distance above the raft at which your object is printed. Smaller values may make the raft harder to remove. Higher values may decrease the quality of your object's bottom surface.
members.name: Raft to Model Spacing

members.description: Distance above the raft at which your object is printed. Smaller values may make the raft harder to remove. Higher values may decrease the quality of your object's bottom surface.
members.name: Raft to Model Spacing

members.description: Sets how far above the raft the supports object is printed. Smaller values may make the support stick more firmly to the raft.  Defaults to the raft model spacing if not set.
members.name: Raft-Support Spacing

members.description: Additional offset between the extruder and build plate when a raft is being printed
members.name: Additional Raft Offset

members.description: Gaps in the raft smaller than this minimum will be filled in, reducing raft complexity
members.name: Minimum Base Pattern Gap

members.description: Select to print your model with easy to remove supports
members.name: Breakaway Support

members.description: Sets the layer height used for support structures. This layer height can be greater than the model layer height for faster printing.
members.name: Support Layer Height

members.description: Support structures will be printed under overhangs where the angle is a greater number of degress than the value set here. A value of 0 will result in support everywhere. A value of 90 will result in no support.
members.name: Support Angle

members.description: Internal angle of the structure - this is the angle that forms along the taper of support structures until the area reaches minAreaToTaperSupportsOut minimum.  It takes into account the layerHeight.
members.name: Support Taper Angle

members.description: External angle of the structure - this is the upper limit of the angle (angle will not be larger in value than this) that forms along the morphing taper of support structures.  Morphing of shapes can accumulate as an ever changing angle depending on geometry of both polygon we are morphing as well as the target polygon we morph towards.  It takes into account the layerHeight.
members.name: Support Morph Angle

members.description: This is a ratio of 2 x area divided by perimeter (loop distance) for our support islands.  When this perimeter is large while the area is small, it means the shape is thin and may fail.  In terms of our tapered support algorithm, we do not want to morph or change the shape when our starting polygon is thin because portions underneath these will morph away, and not receive supports when they require them.
members.name: Support Island Average Width Ratio

members.description: Anything smaller than this area gets expanded to a printable size roughly corresponding to 2 beadwidths so at least an enclosed shell can be extruded.  This value is what determines how much cascading effect our supports have.  Being that supports are drawn top down, the larger this value is, the thicker all downstream supports become through ripple effect.
members.name: Support Minimum Region Area

members.description: Distance between the top-most layer of supports and the printed object in the horizontal plane
members.name: Support Roof to Model Spacing

members.description: Distance between supports and the printed object in the horizontal plane
members.name: Support to Model Spacing

members.description: Distance between the edge of the object and the outer edges of the supports. If it is set to 0, support structures will not extend farther than any supported overhang.
members.name: Support Margin

members.description: Select for less connected support structures which are easier to remove
members.name: Leaky Connections

members.description: Stop support slightly before model floors to allow for easier breakaway.
members.name: Support Cutout

members.description: Extra x/y amount to clear support around model floors when support cutouts are used.
members.name: Support Cutout Extra Distance

members.description: Select to print your model with automatically generated support structures
members.name: Support

members.description: Control the additional droop distance between support floors and the exposed upper layers of your model. Smaller values make the support bind to the model more tightly, higher values make the support easier to remove but less precise and stable.
Thickness of the roof surface layers of the support in mm.  If not a multiple of layer height, the distance is rounded up to the next layer.
Thickness of solid layers under support roof surface in mm.  If not a multiple of layer height, the distance is rounded up to the next layer.
Thickness of the floor surface layers of the support in mm.  If not a multiple of layer height, the distance is rounded up to the next layer.
Thickness of solid layers over support floor surface in mm.  If not a multiple of layer height, the distance is rounded up to the next layer.
For a connection to be made leaky, the lengths of the extrusion paths immediately before and after must exceed this value. This applies to connections between shells, support, and infill
Model fill profiles for surface, solid, and sparse
Model shell profiles for surface, solid, and sparse
Support fill profiles for surface, solid, and sparse
Support shell profiles for surface, solid, and sparse
Raft specific parameters.
Model fill profiles for surface, solid, and sparse
Raft shell profiles for surface, interface, base, and purge_base.
Extruder used to print support structures on a dual extrusion print when Mixed Material Support is turned off. In this selector, 0 is the Right extruder and 1 is the Left extruder.
members.name: Support Material Extruder

members.description: Extruder used to print all regions on interior (solid, sparse - the infill) of a support structure.  Use when mixed material supports provide boost in speed or stability.
members.name: Support Interior Extruder

members.description: Print mixed-material support structures, where each part of the model is supported by structures printed in the same material
members.name: Mixed Material Support

members.description: Print a mixed-material raft, where each part of the model rests on a section of raft printed in the same material
members.name: Mixed Material Raft

members.description: Extrusion width on the purge wall's base layer
members.name: Base Extrusion Width

members.description: Select to end your purge wall once a print no longer toggles between two materials.
members.name: Purge Early End

members.description: Print your model with purge walls. If set to false, purge walls will not be made. If set to true, purge walls will always be made. If unset, purge walls will be made if the print uses more than one extruder. Recommended for dual extrusion prints.
members.name: Purge Walls

members.description: Starting height of the extruder relative to the build plate
members.name: Extra Z Offset

members.description: Initial position of all axes of the bot
Select to use active cooling fan during a print
members.name: Use Active Cooling

members.description: Active cooling fan power
members.name: Fan Power

members.description: Turning the fan off during long travel moves reduces stringing. This value specifies whether this technique is applied

A time window used for modulating the fan. Smaller values cause the fan to switch on and off more frequently. Larger values will ignore some fast and short travel moves to switch the fan less frequently

This is the fraction of time in the fan modulation time window that must be spent extruding (not traveling) for the fan to turn on. Smaller values prefer the fan to be on, larger values prefer the fan to be off. Setting this value to 0.0 is equivalent to having the fan be always on, and setting it to 1.0 is equivalent to having the fan be always off.
Layer at which to start using active cooling
members.name: Fan Layer

members.description: Minimum time for printing a layer.  Layers that will print faster than the minimum will be slowed down. Minimum Layer Duration allows the plastic adequate time to cool before applying the next layer.
members.name: Minimum Layer Duration

members.description: Minimum distance any move can be
Limit the maximum command rate by slowing down in regions of high detail.
members.name: Limit Maximum Command Rate

members.description: Size of the smallest and slowest firmware buffer
members.name: Firmware Buffer Size

members.description: The maximum rate, in commands per second, at which the firmware can reliably and continuously transmit commands.
members.name: Firmware Command Transmission Rate

members.description: The firmware splits moves into segments of this length.
members.name: Firmware Split Move Distance

members.description: No more than this many segments may be split from each end of a move.
members.name: Firmware Split Recursion Depth

members.description: All commands are treated as though they have this many more segments. This results in short moves having a greater impact.
members.name: Split Count Bias

members.description: When slowing down moves to limit the command rate, do not slow to below this fraction of the original speed or the minimum speed, whichever is higher.
members.name: Command Rate Limit - Speed Ratio

members.description: When slowing down moves to limit the command rate, do not slow to below this speed. Moves that are already slower will not be slowed further.
members.name: Command Rate Limit - Minimum Speed

members.description: Enable precise control of speed at the end of paths to reduce stringing. Only works for 5th generation machines
Number of discrete speeds computed for exponential deceleration. Larger numbers give smoother motion at the expense of larger files
Slow to this ratio of the initial speed by the end of exponential deceleration
Exponential deceleration will not cause the speed to fall below this value

members.name: Default Extruder for Single Extruder Printing

members.description: Select to print support under all bridges
members.name: Support Bridges

members.description: A bridge is the underside of a print that is supported at both ends but not in the middle. If a bridge is longer than the length set here, support will be printed underneath.
members.name: Maximum Bridge Length

members.description: Determines how fine the rasterization to discover bridged regions will be - finer rasterization can give better results, but will be much, much slower.
TODO
See roofSurfaceThickness.  Overrides roofSurfaceThickness if set
See roofSolidThickness.  Overrides roofSolidThickness if set
See floorSurfaceThickness.  Overrides floorSurfaceThickness if set
See floorSolidThickness.  Overrides floorSolidThickness if set
The path to the config file. This is set automatically when passing -c on the command line. You should not need to edit this
Avoid using significantly more than this many megabytes of memory
Start each layer from the object closest to a fixed location, rather than closest to where the previous layer ended
members.name: Fixed Layer Starting Point

members.description: X position of the point near which to start a layer when Fixed Layer Starting Pt is true
members.name: Layer Starting Point (X)

members.description: Y position of the point near which to start a layer when Fixed Layer Starting Pt is true
members.name: Layer Starting Point (Y)

members.description: Start each shell at the vertex farmost in the direction specified by Fixed Shell Starting Point. If not selected, the starting point will be chosen for optimal ordering, and may cause the zipper to be a different place on every layer.
members.name: Fixed Shell Starting Point

members.description: Controls roughly where the zipper will be placed. 0 points toward the back of the printer. The zipper clockwise as the angle increases.
members.name: Shell Starting Point (degrees)

members.description: If nonzero magnitude, adds a travel move in a specified direction when starting each set of island shells.
members.name: Travel Offset from Shell Starting Point

members.description: Do minfill.
Thickness of minfill surface roof in mm.  If not a multiple of layer height, the distance is rounded up to the next layer.
Thickness of minfill solid roof in mm.  Overrides minfillRoofThickness if larger.  If not a multiple of layer height, the distance is rounded up to the next layer.
Roof anchor margins for very sparse areas, see description of roofAnchorMargins
Up to this angle roof is not going to be suppoted.
The angle at which shrinking minfill structures can slant.
Max bounding cube side that results in strong, good quality walls with 0% infill.
Max z height that results in strong, good quality walls with 0% infill.
Modifies algorithmically calculated morphological-closing distance value.
The angle at which upward srinking minfill structures can slant.
Experimentally determined stable square side(in mm) within which area minfill pillars can grow to large heights before pillar areas have to massivley expand without to guarantee stability.
Minimum fraction of xy area needed for stability of minfill pillars supportin it without considering z height. Pillar are will not be allowes to shrink below this minimum.

Once below this threshold (sq. mm), top-most minfill area identified will not be supported by minfill. This is the area identified after allowed overhang distance has already been inset. So it can not be large.
When new minfill areas for a given layer are identified, slivers beyond this morphological opening distance are cleaned up (in mm).

Inset distance used to identify disappearing areas during downward shrinking. Areas that are disappearing too quickly to print during shrinking, will be preserved and this value determines how wide those structures will be.
Once minfillDisappearingInsetDist is applied to an area, this config specifies minimum area leftover required for shrinking to proceed.

Fraction of minfillDisappearingAreasInsetDist to be applied to the remaining area determines how quickly that area would be disappearing under continued insetting. Determines how quickly thinning areas are allowed to disappear.
In order to identify 2d local work areas, detected disappeare areas are outset and intersected with the remaining parts of the model, this is the outsetting distance(in mm) used for such detection.
Once centers of work areas are identified, those are outset to generate work areas. This is the distance of the outset in mm.
Outset/inset distance used for closing tiny holes in minfill areas resulting from roof replacement
Number of first layers with extra adhesion to the surface below.
Inset/outset distance used for sliver cleanup in minfill areas resulting from roof replacement
Minimum guarateed distance from minfill area boundary to roofs on the same layer within xy plane.
Extrusion Profile to use for high heat capacity thick outline structures.
Extrusion Profile to use for low heat capacity thin outline structures.
Minimum area such that its shell maintains structural stability when printed.

members.name: When moving up in Z-height, print with the last-used material first to minimize toolchanges.

members.description: Use relative extruder positions for motors in Json Toolpath output only (never GCode).  Absolute position and relative positions have different outcomes through Firmware.  (2018-05-17) Useful to get around a blobbing on restart from pause issue, but in future this key may possibly be deprecated.
members.name: Use Relative Extruder Positions

members.description: Extruder with which the entire base layer will be printed.
members.name: Extruder with which to print the base layer

members.description: Whether or not we want to do a z-hop when toggling extruders
members.name: Do Z-Hop on Extruder Toggle

members.description: Area under which a layer will be considered 'small'
members.name: Area under which a layer will be considered 'small'
